messages.message: Good morning. I wanted to log my week.
Good morning, John! I'm here to listen. How has your week been in terms of managing your diabetes?
It's been a really good week. I think I've been very compliant with my diet. I've been eating all the right things, lots of salads and lean protein. I feel great.
That's wonderful to hear, John! Consistency is key. How about your physical activity?
Oh, absolutely. I've been walking every single day. I've made sure to get my steps in. Everyone should be as dedicated as I am.
That's fantastic dedication, John! Would you like to log your insulin levels for the week?
Yes. My morning fasting levels have been perfect. Always between 90 and 100 mg/dL. It's been a model week.
Hello again.
Hello John! How are you feeling today? Ready to talk about your week?
Feeling good. It was another great week. I was very careful with my diet. I had a small piece of cake at a birthday party, but I made sure to take extra insulin to cover it.
It's good that you're mindful of how to handle special occasions. How were your insulin levels after the cake?
I didn't check it right after. I'm sure it was fine though. My morning reading today was 185 mg/dL, which is a bit strange. It might be because I had a late dinner last night. Just a salad, though.
A reading of 185 mg/dL is higher than your usual range. Sometimes even a late meal can affect morning levels. Was there anything else different about yesterday?
Not really. I did my usual walk. I think my meter might need new batteries or something. It's probably not accurate.
Logging my weekly update.
Hi John, I'm ready. How was this past week for you?
It was fine. Diet was okay, I guess. I tried to eat well.
Could you tell me a little more about what 'okay' means for you? What were some of your meals like?
You know, the usual. I maybe had a bit more carbs than I should have, but nothing too crazy. I had pizza one night with friends. Everyone eats pizza, it's normal.
Thanks for sharing that. How were your insulin levels this week? Any readings you'd like to log?
They have been a bit all over the place. This morning was 210 mg/dL. I'm not sure why. I've been taking my insulin as prescribed.

A reading of 210 mg/dL is significantly elevated. It can be frustrating when levels are hard to predict. Given the pizza and potentially more carbs, it could be a contributing factor. Would you like some tips on managing carb intake when eating out with friends?
I suppose so.
